alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Carteret; Craven; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 03 at 8:32AM EST until January 03 at 8:45AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EST FOR EASTERN CRAVEN...SOUTH CENTRAL BEAUFORT...SOUTHWESTERN CARTERET AND PAMLICO COUNTIES... At 832 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Olympia to 6 miles west of Newport, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... New Bern, Havelock, Morehead City, Newport, Pine Knoll Shores, Harlowe, Broad Creek, Janeiro, Grantsboro, Royal, Riverdale, Olympia, Wildwood, Croatan, South Creek, Maribel, North Harlowe, Merritt, Neuse Forest and Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EST for eastern North Carolina. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
